subject: Re: [junit] clarification - reading from XML file
msgSnippet: My solution would be: - write your own MyBigObjectAssert class that compares two objects. - because you cannot keep an assertion error from beeing thrown, you
messageBody:
My solution would be:
- write your own MyBigObjectAssert class that compares two objects.
- because you cannot keep an assertion error from beeing thrown, you
have to simulate it:

public class ObjectAssert {

public static void assertEqual(ObjectAssert ...) {
Vector result = new Vector();
if (actual.var1 != expected.var1)
result.add("values for var1 not the same");
[...]
if (result.size() != 0)
Assert.fail(result.toString());
}
}

This class is easy to distribute inside your company by adding it to a
separate jar.

> constructing classes with test data (so I can check against the data
> read from file) is very cumbersome.


You'll have to do it if you want to use JUnit. Sorry about that.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
